patterns: Tell me about food safety
How can I ensure food safety?
Tips for safe food handling
responses: Food safety is crucial! Always wash your hands before handling food.
To ensure food safety, cook meat thoroughly and refrigerate leftovers promptly.
Practice good hygiene in the kitchen to prevent foodborne illnesses.

patterns: How can I scan a food product?
Tell me about food scanning
Scan food for safety
responses: Sure! To scan a food product, please provide the product name and its brand name.
I can help you with food scanning. Please provide the product name and brand name.

patterns: Product name is [product_name]
Brand name is [brand_name]
I want to scan [product_name] by [brand_name]
responses: Great! Thank you for providing the product name as [product_name] and brand name as [brand_name].

patterns: Can you upload a photo of the ingredients?
Please attach a photo of the ingredients

responses: Sure! To proceed, please upload a photo of the ingredients.

patterns: I have uploaded the photo
Photo of ingredients is attached
Uploaded the picture
responses: Great! The photo of the ingredients has been received and stored.

patterns: How would you like to see the results?
Visual representation or detailed report?
Choose result format
responses: Excellent! How would you like to see the results? Visual representation or a detailed report?

patterns: Thanks for the food safety information
Appreciate the help on food safety
Thank you for the food scanning assistance
responses: You're welcome! If you have more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask.

patterns: Tell me a joke!
Tell me something funny!
Do you know a joke?
responses: Why did the hipster burn his mouth? He drank the coffee before it was cool.
What did the buffalo say when his son left for college? Bison.

patterns: Tell me a food fact
Give me an interesting food fact
Share some food knowledge
responses: Certainly! Did you know that tomatoes are technically fruits, but the U.S. Supreme Court classified them as vegetables in 1893 for tariff purposes?
Here's a food fact: The world's largest pizza was made in 2012 in Rome. It measured 1261.65 square meters (13,570.28 square feet)!
Did you know that avocados are berries and are also known as 'alligator pears'? They are rich in healthy monounsaturated fats.
The spice saffron is more expensive than gold by weight! It takes a vast number of saffron flowers to produce a small amount of the spice.
An average ear of corn has an even number of rows, usually 16. Each row typically has 800 kernels arranged in 16 rows.
Certainly! Did you know that honey never spoils? Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.
Here's a food fact for you: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't! In botanical terms, bananas qualify as berries, while strawberries are considered aggregate fruits.
Did you know that chocolate was once used as currency? The Aztecs used cocoa beans as a form of currency during the height of their civilization.

patterns: What safety guidelines should I follow while scanning food products?
Can you provide tips for ensuring food safety at home?
Tell me about common safety practices in the food industry.
responses: Ensure proper hygiene while handling and preparing food.
Always check for expiration dates on food products.
Wash fruits and vegetables thoroughly before consumption.

patterns: How can I identify harmful ingredients in a product?
Tell me about common allergens found in food.
What are the key things to check for in ingredient lists?
responses: Look out for additives and preservatives in ingredient lists.
Common allergens include nuts, dairy, and gluten.
Check for artificial colors and flavors in the ingredients.

patterns: How should I properly store different types of food?
What are the best practices for preserving the freshness of food products?
Tell me about the shelf life of common pantry items.
responses: Store perishable items in the refrigerator to extend their shelf life.
Use airtight containers to keep food fresh and prevent spoilage.
Pay attention to storage instructions on packaging for optimal freshness.

patterns: Can you provide tips for maintaining a balanced diet?
Tell me about the nutritional benefits of certain foods.
Provide guidance on interpreting food labels for nutritional information.
responses: Include a variety of fruits and vegetables in your daily diet.
Certain foods like salmon and nuts are rich in omega-3 fatty acids.
Check food labels for information on calories, fat, and vitamins.

patterns: What safety precautions should I take while cooking?
Tell me about safe temperatures for cooking different foods.
How can I avoid foodborne illnesses during meal preparation?
responses: Wash hands thoroughly before handling food to prevent contamination.
Cook meats to their recommended internal temperatures to ensure safety.
Avoid cross-contamination by using separate cutting boards for raw and cooked foods.

patterns: How can I check if a food product has been recalled?
Tell me about recent food recalls and their reasons.
Provide guidance on handling recalled products.
responses: Check the official recall website or contact the manufacturer for product recalls.
Recent recalls may be announced in the news or on the product's official website.
If you suspect a product has been recalled, discontinue use and follow the provided instructions.

patterns: What's the latest news in the food industry?
Can you share insights into current food trends?
Tell me about recent advancements in food safety technology.
responses: Stay updated on food industry news through reputable news sources and publications.
Current food trends include plant-based diets and sustainable eating.
Advancements in food safety technology focus on improved testing methods and traceability.

patterns: How do different food choices impact the environment?
Tell me about sustainable food practices.
Provide tips for making eco-friendly food choices.
responses: Consider the carbon footprint of food production and transportation.
Sustainable practices include choosing local and seasonal produce.
Reduce food waste by planning meals and utilizing leftovers.

patterns: Ask about the product name and brand name
Ask the user to add a photo of ingredients
Ask the user to present results in which format (visual representation and detailed report)
responses: Sure! What is the name of the product you'd like to scan?
Great! Please provide the brand name of the product.
To proceed, could you upload a photo of the ingredients or text on the packaging?

patterns: Tell me some food facts
Share interesting food information
Give me trivia about food
responses: Did you know that honey never spoils? Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible!
Broccoli is not a natural plant. It was cultivated by humans in the northern Mediterranean starting in about the 6th century BC.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't. In botanical terms, a berry is a fruit produced from a single ovary, and bananas qualify, while strawberries do not.
